title: Commending David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. upon the occasion of receiving the 2010 Business of the Year Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. upon
the occasion of receiving the 2010 Business of the  Year  Award  by  the
Town of Montgomery Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS,  Businesses  which provide outstanding services to residents of
the communities of the State of New York are deserving of public  recog-
nition and applause for their efforts; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
David  H.  Tompkins & Sons, Inc. upon the occasion of receiving the 2010
Business of the  Year  Award  by  the  Town  of  Montgomery  Chamber  of
Commerce; and
  WHEREAS, David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. was honored on April 21, 2010,
at the Colden Manor at Spruce Lodge in Montgomery, New York; and
  WHEREAS, In 1928, David H. Tompkins was a young man of 21 years deliv-
ering  milk  in Bangor, Maine; one day he noticed four wooden drill rigs
on a street and a man saw the curious David Tompkins  checking  out  the
rigs and explained to him that the rigs were bound for Ohio and asked if
he would like to join on; and
  WHEREAS,  After David Tompkins said yes, the group traveled, but never
made it to Ohio; on the third day of the trip, one  of  the  rigs  broke
down  in  Newburgh, New York some 60 miles north of New York City; there
were no well drillers in the location at that time and when  people  saw
the  rigs, they bombarded the crew with numerous requests to drill water
wells; and
  WHEREAS, The rest of the trip was scrapped and  shop  was  set  up  in
Newburgh;  while  drilling a water well at a boarding house, David Tomp-
kins met Madeline Cosman, whom he married on Christmas Eve in 1933;  the
couple  moved  to  Montgomery,  New York, the following year, and in the
later years, the business grew, along with the family; and
  WHEREAS, A daughter, Joan, was born in 1936, and son David B. Tompkins
entered the scene in 1939; another son, Rick, came along in 1947, and in
1959, Tompkins Well Drilling moved its operations to Fort Myers,  Flori-
da,  where  the business had a two-year run before returning to Montgom-
ery, its home to this day; and
  WHEREAS, The well drilling and pump installation company was  incorpo-
rated  in 1964; in 1965, the company purchased its first rotary drill, a
brand new model from H.M. Kordick  of  Seymour,  Connecticut;  David  H.
Tompkins passed away in 1989 and his two sons took over the business; in
1996,  older  brother  David left for Missouri, where he and his son run
their own drilling contracting firm; and
  WHEREAS, Currently, younger brother Rick is running  the  77  year-old
business  as  owner and president, and his lovely wife, Aline, is secre-
tary, making sure the office runs smoothly; and
  WHEREAS, The services David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. provide are most-
ly residential water wells and about 30 percent commercial 8-inch  wells
for municipalities; they cover a 100-mile radius from Montgomery; and
  WHEREAS,  Businesses  such  as  David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. exert a
strong, positive influence on the  communities  they  serve  and  are  a
crucial element in the economy of New York State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend David H. Tompkins & Sons, Inc. upon the  occasion  of  receiving
the 2010 Business of the Year Award by the Town of Montgomery Chamber of
Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Rick Tompkins, President.
